description:
As a Lead Machinist, you will be working with the Google Hardware Design team to produce prototypes of concepts and products. This will include fixture design and implementation, CNC machine programming, setup and operation. You will setup, run, and maintain complex machines and orient, train, and review the work of other machinists. You'll provide support for machining operations of parts and assemblies using manual and/or CNC machine tools.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 10 years of experience in a prototype/short-run environment.
  • 5 years of experience with 5-axis CNC milling machines.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with CNC automation equipment.
  • Experience with the full spectrum of model and prototype development.
  • Experience engaging customers in the strategic planning of their product development initiative relative to providing sound model and prototype strategies to achieve their design intent.
  • Experience training and developing team members in programming, setup, and fixturing for prototype work.
  • Outstanding mechanical aptitude and spatial ability. Passion for collaborating with diverse technical and non-technical groups.
responsibilities:
• Program and run one-off or short run prototype jobs efficiently and in a timely manner.
  • Maintain specifications by performing drilling, grooving, and cutting.
  • Work with other Machinists, Project Managers, Engineers and Designers to solve problems and improve processes. Collaborate with other machinists on technique to improve output, quality, cost, and delivery of prototypes.
  • Engage with the model shop team to resolve complex design challenges and improve model shop workflow.
  • Participate in educational opportunities, read technical publications, attend conferences/trade shows, and experiment with new processes and technology.
title: Lead Machinist, Consumer Hardware
